trans-unit.source: Definition of the WS-Trust service contract implementation.
Implements the following service contract interfaces:
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract"></xref> class.
The configuration object that initializes this instance.
Configures any binding elements to support the contract behavior.
The contract description to modify.
The endpoint to modify.
The objects that binding elements require to support the behavior.
The contract description for which the extension is intended.
The contract description for which the extension is intended.
The endpoint.
The client runtime.
Implements a modification or extension of the client across a contract.
The contract description to be modified.
The endpoint that exposes the contract.
The dispatch runtime that controls service execution.
Begins an asynchronous call to <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract.DispatchRequest(System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext)"></xref>.
Defines the request parameters to process and exposes properties that determine the response message and action.
An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the dispatch is complete.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous dispatch request from other requests.
A <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> that represents the asynchronous operation.
Used as the input to the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract.EndDispatchRequest(System.IAsyncResult)"></xref> method.
Handles an asynchronous call to the STS.
The incoming request message.
The WS-Trust request Serializer.
The WS-Trust response Serializer.
The request SOAP action.
The response SOAP action.
The namespace URI of the WS-Trust version of the incoming request.
A callback that gets invoked when the asynchronous call ends.
An object that contains state information for the asynchronous call.
IAsyncResult that should be passed back to the End method to complete the Asynchronous call.
One of the argument is null.
Processes an asynchronous call to the WS-Trust Feb 1.3 Cancel message.
The incoming request message.
A callback to be invoked when the asynchronous operation ends.
An object that contains the asynchronous state.
The <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> that should be passed back to the corresponding end method to complete the asynchronous call.

Creates a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext"></xref> object for use by the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract.DispatchRequest(System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext)"></xref> method.
The incoming request message.
The SOAP action of the request.
The default SOAP action of the response.
Namespace URI of the WS-Trust version of the incoming request.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustRequestSerializer"></xref> used to deserialize incoming RST messages.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustResponseSerializer"></xref> used to deserialize incoming RSTR messages.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> to use when deserializing incoming messages.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext"></xref> object.
Creates a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> object using the local resolver information of the WSTrustServiceClient.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> initialized with the current resolver information.
Processes a WS-Trust request message, and optionally determines the appropriate response message and the WS-Addressing action for the response message.
Defines the request parameters to process and exposes properties that determine the response message and action.
Completes an asynchronous call to <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract.DispatchRequest(System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext)"></xref>.

<xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> that was returned by the call to the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract.BeginDispatchRequest(System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)"></xref> method.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext"></xref> that exposes properties that determine the response message and action.
Completes an asynchronous call to the STS.
The <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> that was returned by the call to the asynchronous begin method.
The request SOAP Action.
The response SOAP Action.
The namespace URI of the current WS-Trust version.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> object that contains the serialized RST message.
One of the arguments is `null`.

When implemented in a derived class, writes custom Web Services Description Language (WSDL) elements into the generated WSDL for a contract.
Provides an implementation of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportContract%2A> method.
The default implementation does nothing.
You can override this method in a derived class to implement specific behavior.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter"></xref> that exports the contract information.
Provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the contract description.
Writes custom Web Services Description Language (WSDL) elements into the generated WSDL for an endpoint.
Implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportEndpoint%2A> method.
The default implementation does the following for every WS-Trust contract found:
Includes the appropriate WS-Trust namespace in the WSDL.
Imports the appropriate WS-Trust schema and all dependent schemas.
Fixes the Messages of each operation to appropriate WS-Trust equivalents.
The WS-Trust Contract exposed by Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) takes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> in and returns a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> out.
But WS-Trust messages expect an RST and return an RSTR/RSTRC.
This method fixes the message names with the appropriate WS-Trust messages.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter"></xref> that exports the contract information.
Provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the endpoint description.
During WSDL generation, this method fixes a specified operation message element to refer to the RST and RSTR elements of the appropriate WS-Trust version.
The WS-Trust Contract exposed by Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) takes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> in and returns a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> out.
But WS-Trust messages expect an RST and return an RSTR/RSTRC.
This method fixes the message names with the appropriate WS-Trust messages specified by the XML qualified names in `inputMessageElement` and `outputMessageLement`.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> that has the current state of the exported WSDL.
The WSDL PortType for which the messages are to be fixed.
Provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the endpoint description.
The operation name inside the PortType.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> of the input message element.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> of the output message element.
serviceDescription is `null`.
-or-
portType is `null`.
-or-
inputMessageType is `null`.
-or-
outputMessageType is `null`.
operationName is `null` or Empty.
Returns the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that will be used when resolving tokens and keys in the WS-Trust message body.
The security token resolver that will be used when resolving tokens and keys in the WS-Trust message body.

Returns the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that resolves the following security tokens contained in the security header of the current WCF message request: protection token, endorsing, or signed endorsing supporting tokens.
This <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver> is used to resolve any SecurityTokenIdentifiers when deserializing RST UseKey elements or RST RenewTarget elements.
The context associated with the request.
The security token resolver that is used to resolve any SecurityTokenIdentifiers when deserializing RST UseKey elements or RST RenewTarget elements.
requestContext is `null`.

Raises the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract.RequestFailed"></xref> event and converts the specified exception to a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.FaultException"></xref> if required.

If the original exception was a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.FaultException"></xref> or if the PreserveOriginalException flag is set to `true`, the conversion to a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.FaultException"></xref> is not performed.
The original exception.
The namespace of the current WS-Trust version.
The WS-Trust action that caused the exception.
The SOAP version of the request envelope.
Returns <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref>.
`false` if the original exception is thrown.
Imports all of the required schemas if not already present in the WSDL.
The default implementation imports the following schemas: WS-Trust Feb 2005 and WS-Trust 1.3.
You can override this method in derived classes to import other schemas.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter"></xref> that exports the contract information.
Provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the endpoint description.
The current WS-Trust namespace for which the schemas are imported.
exporter is `null`.
-or-
context is `null`.
ns is `null` or an empty string.
The namespace specified in ns is not a recognized WS-Trust namespace.
Adds the required WS-Trust namespaces to the WSDL if not already present.
Provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the endpoint description.
The prefix of the namespace to be included.
The namespace to be included.
context is `null`.
Handles synchronous calls to the STS.

Occurs when a failure happens processing a WS-Trust request from the client.
For more information, see the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract.HandleException%2A> method.
Gets the service configuration.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenServiceConfiguration"></xref> that represents the configuration for the service.
When implemented in a derived class, confirms that the contract and endpoint can support the contract behavior.
The default implementation just returns without throwing an exception.
This indicates that the specified contract and endpoint are valid.
Inherited from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior>.
The contract to validate.
The endpoint to validate.
Validates the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext"></xref> object.

This method ensures that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext> Object represents a legal request prior to being passed into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract.DispatchRequest%2A> method.
The default implementation rejects incoming RST messages with RSTR actions and vice versa.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext"></xref> object to validate.
